This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier."},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. initialize(address,string).details: This function is called once during contract deployment.

params.baseURI: The base URI for the NFT metadata.
params.initialOwner: The address of the contract owner.

mintCopy(address,uint256,string).custom:reverts: ChatterPayNFT__OriginalTokenNotMinted if the original token does not exist.ChatterPayNFT__LimitExceedsCopies if the copy limit for the original token is reached.
mintCopy(address,uint256,string).details: Each copy has a unique token ID derived from the original token ID and copy count.

params.originalTokenId: The token ID of the original NFT.
params.to: The address to receive the copied NFT.
params.uri: The metadata URI for the copied NFT.

mintOriginal(address,string).custom:reverts: ChatterPayNFT__TokenAlreadyMinted if the token ID is already minted.
mintOriginal(address,string).details: The token ID is auto-incremented, and every 10th token ID is skipped.

params.to: The address to receive the minted NFT.
params.uri: The metadata URI for the NFT.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

setBaseURI(string).details: Only callable by the contract owner.

setCopyLimit(uint256,uint256).custom:reverts: ChatterPayNFT__Unauthorized if the caller is not the original minter.ChatterPayNFT__LimitExceedsCopies if the new limit is less than the current copy count.
setCopyLimit(uint256,uint256).details: Only the original minter of the NFT can update the copy limit.

params.tokenId: The token ID of the original NFT.

returns._0: True if the interface is supported, false otherwise.

tokenURI(uint256).details: Combines logic from ERC721 and ERC721URIStorage.

returns._0: The token URI as a string.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

initialize(address,string).notice: Initializes the contract with an initial owner and base URI.

mintCopy(address,uint256,string).notice: Mints a copy of an existing original NFT.

setBaseURI(string).notice: Updates the base URI for NFT metadata.

setCopyLimit(uint256,uint256).notice: Updates the copy limit for an original NFT.

supportsInterface(bytes4).notice: Checks if the contract supports a specific interface.

tokenURI(uint256).notice: Returns the URI for a given token ID.

documentation.text:
@notice Retrieves the base URI for NFT metadata.
 @return The base URI as a string.
